cheatsheet.title: Create a new column set analysis

intro.description: This kind of analysis examines the content of a set of columns. The analysis returns the row count, distinct count, unique count and duplicate count.

item.title: Set the analysis metadata.
item.description: To open the Create New Analysis wizard, right click Analyses on the DQ Repository view and select New Analysis. Then expand Table Analysis and select Column Set Analysis. The wizard prompts you to provide the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description...). Upon completion, an editor opens in which you can modify the analysis metadata and define the analysis settings.

item.title: Select the columns to analyze.
item.description:
In the editor, click Analyzed Columns (or click the link below). Then click Select Columns to open a dialog box in which you can browse to and select the columns to analyze. Alternatively, you can drop the columns from the DQ Repository tree view onto the Analyzed Columns box in the editor.
Under Datamining Type, define the type of the corresponding column.
Note: Nominal means that the column contains textual values (no order or mathematical function applicable). Interval means that mathematical functions (such as the average) can be used.

item.title: Set the indicator options.
item.description: Click the Options button next to each indicator you want to set parameters for. Then enter the higher and lower threshold values. By default, standard parameters are set.

item.title: Choose a pattern for each column
item.description: For each column, you can add a pattern indicator. There are two kinds of patterns. Regular patterns are regular expressions (not supported by all databases) and SQL patterns are the patterns that you add in a "LIKE" clause. Click the add pattern button next to each column, then browse to and select the pattern you want to add in the dialog box which appears. Alternatively, drop a pattern from the Repository view onto a column.

item.title: Set filters on the data to be analyzed.
item.description: This is an optional step. By default, all of the data is analyzed. To filter the data, write an SQL "WHERE" clause in the Data Filter text box.

item.title: Analyze.
item.description: Click the Run icon, located towards the top left of the editor, to execute the analysis. Alternatively, right click the analysis on the DQ Repository tree view and click the Run icon on the list which appears.
